module.name: state_based_behaviour
module.keywords: module, state based, behaviour, statechart, behaviour, behavior, state machine

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of state-based behaviour.

inscope.li: the definition of a versioned behaviour
the state-based behaviour representation of a versioned behaviour

usage_guide.p: Implementations of this part of ISO 10303 make use of the capability to classify an entity type using . This annex contains a subclause for each entity type defined in this part of ISO 10303 for which that capability shall be applied. The specified Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI) is used to identify each class.
UML diagrams are used to represent the classes related to the EXPRESS entity types in question. The following UML Stereotypes are utilized.

ul.li: expressEntityType applied to a UML Class denotes the EXPRESS entity type
owlClass applied to a UML Class denotes the related class
classificationAssignment applied to a UML Generalization denotes the fact that the EXPRESS entity type that is the general class can be classified using the more specific class

usage_guide.p: Additionally, the disjointWith constraint is applied where appropriate to specify the set of subclasses are mutually exclusive. This is the equivalent of the EXPRESS ONEOF concept.

guide_subclause.title: Classifications of State_definition
guide_subclause.p:
